definition: to admit/to concede/to recognize/recognition (diplomatic, artistic etc)/to acknowledge
to bear/to carry/to hold/to continue/to undertake/to take charge/owing to/due to/to receive
surname Cheng/Cheng (c. 2000 BC), third of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God

sentences.english: And Vergeer admits that "sometimes it's tiring always trying to improve.
sentences.chinese: 沃吉尔承认，“有时会对无尽的提高而感到厌烦。”

sentences.english: But Baldwin admits his officers can't catch everything using scanners.
sentences.chinese: 鲍尔温承认工作人员无法用扫描仪监控所有物品。

sentences.english: It was time to write down and acknowledge that he was gone.
sentences.chinese: 这是记下和承认它已经离去这一事实的时候。

sentences.english: So we need to recognize that.
He says some people admitted they had killed their children.
sentences.chinese: 他说一些人承认他们曾杀过自己的孩子。

sentences.english: And then you go forward on that basis.
sentences.chinese: 承认了错误，才能继续前进。

sentences.english: But Ms. Hicks resisted any suggestion that she is capitalizing on the proceedings.
sentences.chinese: 但是，希克斯女士拒绝承认，说她是借题炒作。

sentences.english: Is it really the case that the G8 is prepared to admit to its own stinginess?
sentences.chinese: 八国集团这一次真的要承认自己吝啬了？

sentences.english: I think you should just admit that you're a big softy .
sentences.chinese: 呃，我觉得你得承认自己挺多愁善感。

sentences.english: Murray admitted giving Jackson a small dose of propofol to help him sleep.
sentences.chinese: 穆雷承认给了杰克逊一小剂异丙酚来匡助他睡眠。

sentences.english: They take a day of sick leave rather than admit to being off because of pet bereavement.
sentences.chinese: 他们宁可请病假而不愿承认因为痛失宠物而请假。

sentences.english: She admits other girls her age were jealous of her and would pick on her at school.
sentences.chinese: 她承认其他同龄女孩嫉妒她并在学校里作弄她。

sentences.english: Raj: Y've been a sucky friend, a sucky, sucky friend.
sentences.chinese: 听着，我承认我并非一直是个称职的朋友。

sentences.english: Toyota has made it clear that although it was paying the fine, it was not admitting to any wrongdoing.
sentences.chinese: 丰田虽然已缴款，但拒不承认有过失。

sentences.english: The bad news - 90% of people admit that they would kill someone.
sentences.chinese: 坏消息是，90%的人都承认他们会杀人。

sentences.english: West Ham have admitted that they fielded players illegally.
sentences.chinese: 西汉姆承认他们是非法引进球员。

definition: to declare to be untrue/to deny
to explain/to justify/to defend (a point of view etc)/to provide an explanation/to try to defend oneself
to declare one's position/to say where one stands
to express/to show/to say/to state/to indicate/to mean
to confirm (sth to be true)/to verify
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
